title: Drawing, Elevation of an altar in a private chapel
title_raw: Elevation of an altar in a private chapel
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Recto and Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle. Above the altar ledge stand four candlesticks, a crucifix, Mary and St. John. Above is the frame for a picture. A trophy of the arms of teh Passion is in the panel  above it. The wall is divided into a dad and panels. Written below, at right: "Capellata privata," in the upper left corner: "98."  Reverse: Sketches for the decoration of a dado.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Elevation of an altar in a private chapel. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2624.
